alert.note: Alert for Carter; Johnston; Marshall; Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 9:53AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Johnston, southeastern Carter, southwestern Pontotoc, northwestern Marshall and Murray Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 952 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Wynnewood to near Lake Of The Arbuckles to 4 miles south of Lone Grove. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Sulphur, Madill, Tishomingo, Davis, Lone Grove, Dickson, Mannsville, Springer, Ravia, Mill Creek, Dougherty, Gene Autry, Hickory, Pontotoc, Lake Of The Arbuckles, Reagan, Turner Falls, Connerville, and Scullin. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 28 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
